benchmark_details.name: Simplicity by Obfuscation: Evaluating LLM-Driven Code Transformation with Semantic Elasticity
benchmark_details.overview: This paper presents an empirical study on the ability of LLMs to obfuscate Python source code. It introduces a metric, 'semantic elasticity', to evaluate the quality of obfuscated code while maintaining functional correctness. The study compares the performance of three leading LLMs (Claude-3.5-Sonnet, Gemini-1.5, GPT-4-Turbo) on a dataset of 30 Python functions.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate how modern LLMs can be applied to code obfuscation while preserving functional integrity and to introduce and validate the 'semantic elasticity' metric.

data.source: 30 Python functions collected from established repositories, including TheAlgorithms/Python, python-patterns, and Problem-Solving with Algorithms and Data Structures.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated as described in the paper using statistical analysis and custom implementations.
methodology.interpretation: Semantically elastic transformations maintain functionality while integrating substantial structural complexity changes.
methodology.validation: Empirical validation through comparisons across different LLMs and prompt techniques.
